section.name: Bpm4Struts Cartridge Namespace Properties
section.p: In addition to the applicable UML Metafacade namespace properties which may also be used, this page describes namespace properties specific to this cartridge only.

tr.td: application JSP pages, login pages and stylesheets are outputted here
The location to which Struts action forms are generated.
The location to which Struts actions are generated.
The location to which abstract controllers are generated.
The location to which the controller implementation classes are generated.
The location to which message resource bundles are generated.
The location to which Struts configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF, such as validation-rules.xml and tiles-defs.xml.
The location where to store application server specific configuration, such as users.properties and roles.properties (in case security has been enabled)
Whether or not to render code enabling the security features (true/false)
The security realm to use when security is enabled.
true/false on whether or not xhtml should be rendered (instead of just normal html).
The name of the JSP that is the welcome file.
true/false, denotes if the client should validate user input.
true/false, denotes if the server should validate user input.
an integer denoting the maximum number of breadcrumbs to appear on a page, specify zero to disable breadcrumbs
true/false, denotes whether or not to render dummy data in things like controllers.
true/false, denotes whether or not to render online help pages.
The default date format to use in case it has not been explicitely specified, for example for action parameters of type Date. Take a look here to see how to properly construct date formats.

The key to lookup warning messages in a scope, the value will be an
ActionMessages instance

The key to lookup success messages in a scope, the value will be an
ActionMessages instance
True/false on whether or not hints should be rendered in the generated JSP pages.
True/false on whether or not redirection should occur on all action forwards.

The pattern to use when constructing the accessor of a back end service to a controller. For example say your controller referenced a service and you were using an axis webservice client stub to access the service, the value of your serviceAccessorPattern would be: new {0}.ws.{1}Locator().get{1}(), where {0} is the package name of the modeled service and {1} is the name of the modeled service.
No, by default no accessors to backend-services are generated.

Used in combination with the serviceAccessorPattern property, this is the pattern to use when constructing the back end service package name. This is useful when your package name may be different than the one in your model (for example when talking to a webservice your client stubs may be in a different package than your modeled ones). If this was the case you'd need to specify something like {0}.ws if your package name was some.package.name and you wanted ws added to each package.
